intro: Mariscus cornutus, commonly known as the horned spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive foliage. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
